1.text: I ask then, did God reject his people? May it never be! In fact, I too am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

2.text: God did not reject his people, which he foreknew. Or do you not know what the Scripture says about Elias (Elijah), how he complained to God against Israel, saying

3.text: “Lord, they have killed your prophets and broken down your altars! I am left alone, and they seek my life.”

4.text: But how does God answer him? “I have reserved for myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to Baal.”

5.text: Likewise, at this present time, there is also a remnant according to the election of grace.

6.text: And if [it is] by grace, then it is no longer of works; otherwise grace is no longer grace.  But if it is of works, it is no longer grace; otherwise work is no longer work.

7.text: What then? Israel did not obtain what it was seeking, but the elect obtained it; and the rest were hardened.

8.text: This is according to what is written:  God gave them a spirit of deep sleep,   Eyes not to see, and ears not to hear,   Even to this very day.

9.text: As David says:  Let their table become a snare and a trap; a stumbling block;   Let it be their recompense!

10.text: Let their eyes be darkened so that they may not see,   And keep their backs forever bent.

11.text: I ask then, did they stumble in order to fall? May it never be! However, by their fall, salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.

12.text: Now if their fall is the treasure of the world, and their loss [has become] the riches of the Gentiles; how much greater riches will their fullness bring!

13.text: For I speak to you who are Gentiles: since I am an apostle to Gentiles, I glorify my ministry.

14.text: May I somehow provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh so that I may save some of them.

15.text: For if their rejection means the reconciling of the world, what would their acceptance be, if not life from the dead?

16.text: If the first fruit is holy, so is the whole batch. If the root is holy, so are the branches.

17.text: But if some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive, were grafted in among them, (having {individually} become partakers with them of the root and of the richness of the olive tree),

18.text: do not boast over the branches! But [even] if you boast, it is not you who support the root, but the root supports you.

19.text: You will then say, “Branches were broken off, so that I might be grafted in!”

20.text: True; by their unbelief they were broken off, and you stand in [your] faith. Do not be full of pride, but fear!

21.text: Certainly, if God did not spare the natural branches, neither will he spare you!

22.text: You see, then, both the goodness and the severity of God. Toward those who fell, severity [was shown]; but toward you, goodness, [that is], if you continue in his goodness. Otherwise you also will be cut off.

23.text: As for them, if they do not continue in their unbelief, they will be grafted in {again}, because God is able to graft them in again.

24.text: If you were cut out of what is by nature a wild olive tree and were grafted against nature into a good olive tree, how much more will the natural branches be grafted into their own olive tree!

25.text: Indeed, I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery, brethren, so that you may not claim to be wiser than you are: a partial hardening has happened to Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles should come in.

26.text: And thus all Israel will be saved. Even as it is written:  There will come out of Zion the Deliverer,   and he will turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

27.text: This is my covenant to them,   When I will take away their sins.

28.text: Concerning the Good News, they are enemies for your sake. But concerning the election, they are beloved for the sake of the forefathers.

29.text: Indeed, without regret are the gifts and the calling of God!

30.text: In the past, you were disobedient to God, but now, you have obtained mercy by their disobedience.

31.text: Likewise, they also have now been disobedient, so that by the mercy shown to you they may also obtain mercy.

32.text: Indeed, God has bound all human beings to disobedience, so that he might have mercy on all.

33.text: Oh the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable are his judgments, and how unfathomable are his ways!

34.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord?   Or who has been his counselor?

35.text: Or who has first given to the Lord so as to be paid back?

36.text: Indeed, from him, and through him, and to him, are all things. To him be the glory unto the ages! Amen.
